sen.j: はしだてとは、西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）が京都駅～天橋立駅間を山陰本線・北近畿タンゴ鉄道北近畿タンゴ鉄道宮福線・北近畿タンゴ鉄道宮津線経由で運行する特別急行列車。
sen.e: Hashidate is the name of a limited express train that West Japan Railway Company (JR West) operates between Kyot Station and Amanohashidate Station via San'in Main Line, Miyafuku Line of Kitakinki Tango Railway Corporation and Miyazu Line of Kitakinki Tango Railway Corporation.

sen.e: It was namded after the "red orge" in an ogre-related legend remaining around Oe-yama Mountain Range towering along Miyafuku Line of Kitakinki Tango Railway Corporation, on which this train also runs.

sen.j: 「はしだて」は、1965年より1968年まで大阪駅～天橋立駅間を福知山線・山陰本線・宮津線経由で運行する準急列車の名称として使用されたのが初出とされる。
sen.e: It is said that the name of "Hashidate" was first used for a semi-express train operated in 1965 to 1968 between Osaka Station and Amanohashidate Station via Fukuchiyama Line, San'in Main Line and Miyazu Line.

sen.j: 1968年、「きのさき (列車)」に吸収される。
sen.e: The express train merged into the "Kinosaki" train.

sen.j: ちなみに現行ダイヤで運行される列車として近いものは特急「文殊 (列車)」・「タンゴディスカバリー」が相当する。

sen.e: In between 1982 and 1992, "Hashidate" was an express train operated between Fukui Staion (Fukui Prefecture) and Amanohashidate via Obama Line and Miyazu Line.
In the period from 1982 to 1992, "Hashidate" was an express train operated between Fukui Station (Fukui Prefecture) and Amanohashidate via the Obama and Miyazu lines.

sen.j: なお、同区間には「わかさ」が運行されており、また同区間を運行していた急行列車であった「大社」についてもここで記す。
sen.e: "Wakasa" was also operated between the two stations above; A description is also made for Taisha, an express train operated between the two stations as well.
"Wakasa" was also operated between those two stations; a description is also made for Taisha, an express train that was operated between the two stations as well.
Wakasa' was also operated between those two stations; a description is also made for 'Taisha,' an express train that was operated between the two stations as well.

sen.j: 1961年3月1日：西舞鶴駅～金沢駅間を走る準急列車として「わかさ」誕生。
sen.e: March 1, 1961: "Wakasa" was introduced as a sem-express train running between Nishimaizuru Station and Kanazawa Station.
March 1, 1961: "Wakasa" was introduced as a semi-express train running between Nishimaizuru Station and Kanazawa Station.
March 1, 1961: 'Wakasa' was introduced as a semi-express train running between Nishi-Maizuru Station and Kanazawa Station.

sen.j: 1963年4月20日：「わかさ」、1往復増発し東舞鶴駅・西舞鶴駅～福井駅間の運転となる。
sen.e: April 20, 1963: One up-train service and one down-train service were added to the operation of "Wakasa, becoming operated between Fukui Station and both stations of Higashimaizuru and Nishimaizuru
April 20, 1963: One up-train service and one down-train service were added to the operation of "Wakasa," being operated between Fukui Station and the Higashimaizuru and Nishimaizuru stations.

April 20, 1963: One inbound train service and one outbound train service were added to the operation of 'Wakasa,' being operated between Fukui Station and the Higashi-Maizuru and Nishi-Maizuru stations.
sen.cmt: 上り、下りをinbound, outbound としました。Nishi-Maizuru., Higashi-Maizuru としました。

sen.j: 1964年10月1日：「わかさ」1往復廃止。
sen.e: October 1, 1964: One up-train service and one down-train service of "Wakasa" was abolished.
October 1, 1964: One up-train service and one down-train service of "Wakasa" were abolished.
October 1, 1964: One inbound train service and one outbound train service of 'Wakasa' were abolished.
sen.cmt: 上り、下りをinbound, outbound としました。

sen.j: 但し12月1日の金沢駅～出雲市駅間の急行「あさしお」運転開始まで臨時列車として運転。
sen.e: However, the "Wakasa" special train was operated until operation of the "Asashio" express train started on December 1 between Kanazawa Station and Izumoshi Station.
However, the "Wakasa" special train was operated until the "Asashio" express train came into use on December 1 between Kanazawa Station and Izumoshi Station.

sen.j: 1966年3月5日：「わかさ」急行に格上げ。
sen.e: March 5, 1966: The status of "Wakasa was raised to an express train.
March 5, 1966: The status of "Wakasa" was raised to an express train.
March 5, 1966: The status of 'Wakasa' was raised to an express train.

sen.j: 同年10月1日：名古屋駅～敦賀駅～出雲市駅間を運行する急行「大社」運行開始。
sen.e: October 1, 1966: Operation of the "Taisha" express train started between Nagoya Station, Tsuruga Station and Izumoshi Station.
October 1, 1966: Operation of the "Taisha" express train started between Nagoya Station, Tsuruga Station and Izumoshi Station.
October 1, 1966: Operation of the 'Taisha' express train started between Nagoya Station, Tsuruga Station and Izumoshi Station.

sen.j: 金沢駅～出雲市駅間の急行「あさしお」と敦賀駅～米子駅間で併結運転する多層建て列車となる。
sen.e: This train is operated between Tsuruga Station and Yonago Station, connected with the "Asashio" express train running between Kanazawa Station and Izumoshi Station.
This train is operated between Tsuruga Station and Yonago Station, connected with the "Asashio" express train running between Kanazawa Station and Izumoshi Station.
This train is operated between Tsuruga Station and Yonago Station, connected with the 'Asashio' express train running between Kanazawa Station and Izumoshi Station.

sen.j: 1968年7月：「大社」の補完として「エメラルド」を名古屋～東舞鶴間に運転。
sen.e: July, 1968: Operation of "Emerald" started to supplement that of "Taisha."
July, 1968: The "Emerald" operation started to supplement that of "Taisha."
July, 1968: The 'Emerald' operation started to supplement that of 'Taisha,' running between Nagoya and Higashi-Maizuru.
sen.cmt: 名古屋～東舞鶴 を追加しました。

sen.j: 名古屋から小浜線を経由して出雲市まで運行されていた急行「大社」は、敦賀にて金沢編成と併結する関係上、海水浴シーズンの増結が難しくその補完として運転を開始した。
sen.e: Since the "Taisha" express train, which ran from Nagoya to Izumo City via Obama Line, was connected at Tsuruga to a train organized at Kanazawa, it was difficult in the sea-bathing season to increase the number of its train cars, and therefore, "Emerald" was introduced for supplementing its operation.

Because the "Taisha" express train, which ran from Nagoya to Izumo City via the Obama Line, was connected at Tsuruga to a train organized at Kanazawa, it was difficult in the sea-bathing season to increase the number of its train cars, and therefore "Emerald" was introduced as a means to supplement its operation.

Because the 'Taisha' express train, which ran from Nagoya to Izumo City via the Obama Line, was connected at Tsuruga to a train organized at Kanazawa, it was difficult in the sea-bathing season to increase the number of its train cars, and therefore 'Emerald' was introduced as a means to supplement its operation.

sen.j: その後、「大社」は廃止されるが、「エメラルド」はその後も海水浴シーズンに運行を継続した。
sen.e: Although the operation of "Taisha" was abolished later, "Emerald" continued its operation during the sea-bathing season.
Although the operation of "Taisha" was later abolished, "Emerald" continued to operate during the sea-bathing season.
Although the operation of 'Taisha' was later abolished, 'Emerald' continued to operate during the sea-bathing season.

sen.j: 同列車は1995年まで夏期に運転。
sen.e: " Emerald" was operated in the summer season until 1995.

sen.j: 1978年10月2日：「大社」金沢駅発着編成の運行区間を福井駅～天橋立駅間とする。

sen.j: 1996年3月16日：「わかさ」東舞鶴駅～敦賀駅間の運転となる。

sen.j: 1996年、山陰本線園部駅～福知山駅及び北近畿タンゴ鉄道宮福線福知山駅～宮津駅・北近畿タンゴ鉄道宮津線宮津駅～天橋立駅間の電化により、電車特急を運行。
sen.e: In 1996, the operation of trains between Sonobe Station and Fukuchiyama Station on Sain'in Main Line, between Fukuchiyama Station and Miyazu Station on Miyafuku Line fof Kitakinki Tango Railway Corporation and between Miyazu Station and Amanohashidate on Miyazu Line of Kitakinki Tango Railway Corporation were electrified, andcorrespondingly, operation of electric limited express trains started.

In 1996, the operation of trains between Sonobe Station and Fukuchiyama Station on the Sanin Main Line, between Fukuchiyama Station and Miyazu Station on the Miyafuku Line of Kitakinki Tango Railway Corporation and between Miyazu Station and Amanohashidate Station on the Miyazu Line of Kitakinki Tango Railway Corporation were electrified, and therefore the operation of electric limited express trains started.

sen.j: 2007年3月18日：全面禁煙化を実施。

Since March 18, 2007, smoking has been prohibited throughout the train.
March 18, 2007: Smoking was prohibited throughout the train.
